text: Trailers have come a long way since the
days of voiceover narrator Don La
Fontaine, who would spell out the setup
for a film in plain detail in a world.
While a sizzle reel of funny moments,
explosions, or heartfelt scenes flashed
on the screen, movie trailers have
become more and more revealing, packed
full of eyepopping visuals, and story
details that spoil major events and
twists. Here are Screen Rant's best
movie scenes and twists spoiled by
trailers.
Castaway.
Despite a dramatic buildup to Nolan's
attempted escape, the trailer for the
film made it clear that not only does
our hero find rescue, the footage
outright shows Nolan's reunion with the
fears. We had a funeral and a coffin.
What was in it? Whether the reunion is a
happy one or not is left for filmgoers
to discover, but the Noland and Frier's
relationship status is about the only
major plot development that isn't
covered in the trailer.
Dreamhouse.
The trailer wastes no time in revealing
the film's biggest twist. That Will is a
fake identity Ward concocted in
psychiatric care to hide from the
tragedy of his family's murder. The film
isn't quite as blatant about revealing
that his wife and daughter are
apparitions rather than manifestations
cooked up in his mind. But a trailer
shot of Ghost Libby opening the basement
door plays a key part in the movie
supernatural reveal.
Wreck and Quarantine. Wreck and its
American remake quarantine borrow
heavily from superior zombie/ rabies
outbreak movies, and the trailer still
managed to ruin one major surprise, the
fate of Angela Vidal.
Now, Quarantine wasn't the first horror
movie to spoil the fate of a main
character or use a climactic scene in
trailers. We're looking at you,
Paranormal Activity. But given that
Videll's screaming face is also
plastered on Quarantine's posters, it's
still a pretty shameless marketing move,
even by Hollywood standards.
[Music]
Terminator Salvation.
The trailer for the film spends half of
its runtime setting up the post judgment
day setting and John Connor's gorilla
rebellion against the machines. The
other half outright spoils the film's
most interesting twist, a Terminator
that doesn't know he's a Terminator.
But the preview doesn't stop there. It
also lays out Ray's entire character
arc, specifically that he chooses his
human friends over his machine creators
in the end. Well done, Terminator. Well
done.
I'm the only hope you have.
The Island.
While the island trailer doesn't
outright spoil why Lincoln and Jordan
were created, the footage makes it
crystal clear that the pair are cloned
products. It also shows us that the
island is a cover designed to disguise
the compound's true purpose, extending
the lifespan of wealthy customers by
harvesting organs from living clones.
You still think there's an island?
Free Willie. Given that Free Willie is a
feel-good kids movie, it's no surprise
that Jesse succeeds in freeing Willie.
But trailers for the film really left
little suspense or doubt since the
previews and poster place the final
sequence front and center. But that's
not all. The Free Willie trailers don't
just spoil how Jesse succeeds in
liberating the whale. They also spell
out every up and down in the boy's
transformation from a selfish and
insecure kid to a sensitive and
thoughtful caretaker.
Dawn of the Planet of the Apes. Okay,
it's not an outright spoiler, but Dawn
of the Planet of the Apes trailer put
heavy emphasis on several key sequences,
making it clear who would be responsible
for violating the human ape truce. The
most blatant example of spoilery and
ape's marketing was the use of Koba
placating human enemies with circus-like
ape tricks. Easily one of the best
moments in the film. Understandably,
20th Century Fox knew that such a clever
movie moment would tempt casual viewers
into theaters. But there's no doubt that
the overall impact of the scene, which
is a significant turning point for
Koba's character, was undercut by
previews.
Oblivion.
The Oblivion trailer makes it apparent
that the film's villains, the scavs, are
not aliens. We are human.
They're human freedom fighters waging a
guerilla war against an unseen force.
Led by Malcolm Beach, the Scavs
explained that the film's hero, Jack
Harper, has been manipulated by their
enemy and is unknowingly working against
the survival of his fellow humans.
Thankfully, the Oblivion trailers
refrain from spoiling one of the film's
biggest twists, specifically Harper's
backstory. But with the reveal of the
Scav's identity, it wasn't hard for
savvy movie goers to fill in the blanks
well ahead of director Joseph Kazinski.
Who are you?
I'm your wife.
Ransom. In order to position Ransom as a
deviation from standard kidnapping
thrillers, the studio put a heavy
emphasis on Tom Mullen's unorthodox
approach to finding Shawn. This is your
ransom. You'll never see $1 of this
money. I'm offering this money as a
reward on your head. In doing that, they
outright spoiled one of the film's most
interesting developments and several
tense standoffs that came before it. The
trailer plays Koi with another twist,
one that's revealed in the first 15
minutes. Gary Sen's detective Shaker is
actually the film's primary villain and
hostage taker. Give me back my son. The
Avengers. After killing Agent Coulson to
galvanize the superhero team moving
forward, it was unlikely that another
key Avenger would fall in Marvel's first
multi-hero teamup film. Yet, director
Jos Sweden played up Tony Stark's scene
of sacrifice as if it were a real
possibility that the Avenger might not
make it back to Stark Tower alive.
Unfortunately, the Avengers trailer
undercut any suspense for viewers. It
included a memorable shot of Hulk
leaping into the air and catching a
powered down Iron Man, sucking any
tension out of the film's climactic
moment. at least for anyone who bothered
to watch the preview more than once.
Those are our choices for the best movie
scenes and twists spoiled by trailers.
Got a favorite twist or scene that was
spoiled for you in a movie trailer? Tell
us yours in the comment section. And
don't forget to subscribe to our channel
for more videos like this one.
